p: Calcium perchlorate tetrahydrate (99 %, Sigma Aldrich) was dried (8 h) under reduced pressure to obtain a white powder of anhydrous Ca(ClO 4) 2. Tetrabutylammonium perchlorate (≥99 %, Sigma Aldrich), silver nitrate (99 %, CHEMPUR), and Dimethyl sulfoxide (99.7 %, extra dry, over molecular sieve) were used as received. DMSO, CaClO 4 and TBAClO 4 were stored inside an MBraun glovebox under argon atmosphere. For purging and electrolyte saturation argon (99.999 %, Air liquide), nitrogen (99.999 %, Air liquide), oxygen (99.9995 %, Air liquide) and argon oxygen mixture (80 %/20 %, Air liquide) were used.
